title: The 'far-right clique' behind Yoon Suk Yeol's failed attempt to impose martial law in South Korea
summary: The December 3, 2024, decision was taken by a leader surrounded by a group of people nostalgic for the dictatorship.

title: Black boxes recovered from crash killing 67 people in the deadliest US air disaster in almost a quarter century
summary: An American Airlines flight from Wichita, Kansas, carrying 60 passengers and four crew members, collided with a US military helicopter with three people aboard on Wednesday night. There were no survivors. On Thursday, US media outlets reported that the flight data and cockpit voice recorders had been recovered from the passenger jet.

title: Two buses carrying released Palestinian prisoners reach Ramallah
summary: Among the 110 released prisoners, 66 were freed in the occupied West Bank, nine were released in the Gaza Strip and 14 went to their homes in Israeli-annexed East Jerusalem, according to Amin Shuman, head of the Palestinian Prisoners' Affairs Committee.

title: In Sweden, Salwan Momika, an Iraqi who repeatedly burned the Quran, shot dead in his apartment
summary: Salwan Momika, 38, had arrived in Sweden as a refugee, in 2018. Known for having burned Qurans in the summer of 2023, he was shot dead at his home on Wednesday. Five suspects have been arrested.

title: 'Trump's U-turn on TikTok has two reasons: One is economic, the other political'
summary: In an article for 'Le Monde,' researcher Nathalie Sonnac analyzes the US president's decision to grant a reprieve to the Chinese social media network (which he had hoped to close by 2020), despite the fact that it is contributing to the fragmentation of society and threatening democracy.

title: The portrait of George Washington at Princeton, an American national 'treasure' restored at Versailles
summary: The Centre de Recherche et de Restauration des Musées de France has been commissioned to restore the 1779 painting from the US embassy to its original glory.

title: Elite figure skaters, 'Olympic hopefuls' and coaches on crashed US flight
summary: American Eagle Flight 5342, coming from Wichita, Kansas, collided midair with a US Army helicopter on Wednesday night in Washington DC, crashing into the Potomac River. Former Russian world pairs champions Evgenia Shishkova and Vadim Naumov and as many as 14 American skaters, along with two skating coaches, were among those lost in the crash.

title: Marianne Faithfull, 1960s muse turned musical icon, dies at 78
summary: The life of the British singer, songwriter and actress was as turbulent as it was romantic. A muse to the Rolling Stones, she overcame scandal and addiction to become a torch singer and a lasting cultural figure.

title: ECB lowers interest rates and signals more cuts amid weak growth
summary: The benchmark deposit rate fell by 0.25 percentage points to 2.75%, as expected by most economists.

title: Three Israeli and five Thai hostages freed in Gaza
summary: The chaotic sight of armed fighters escorting Israeli hostages through a crowd of thousands of onlookers caused Israeli leaders to briefly delay the release of the Palestinian prisoners.

title: Germany's Christian Democrats lift 'firewall' against far right
summary: A motion on immigration introduced in the Bundestag by the CDU obtained a majority on Wednesday with support from the far-right AfD. In a rare criticism of her own party, former chancellor Angela Merkel said the move was 'wrong.'

title: At Sarkozy's trial, the battle over a Libyan arms deal and a mysterious letter
summary: Alain Juillet, a former economic intelligence adviser to French prime ministers, shared his perspective on the two intermediaries at the heart of the case of the alleged Libyan financing of Nicolas Sarkozy's presidential campaign: the 'cold animal' Ziad Takieddine and the 'thug' Alexandre Djouhri.

title: French PM's immigration remarks hand a semantic victory to far right
summary: In an interview on Monday, January 27, the centrist prime minister spoke about a 'feeling' of migratory 'submersion.' The far-right Rassemblement National party believes it has 'won the ideological battle.'

title: French convicted rapist Dominique Pelicot questioned over 1990s cases
summary: Dominique Pelicot, 72, who was convicted of the aggravated rape of his ex-wife, Gisèle Pelicot, after a landmark trial, was questioned about a 1991 rape and murder case, and a 1999 attempted rape, which he admitted to.

title: Trump slams Fed chair Powell for maintaining benchmark interest rate
summary: The US president accused Jerome Powell leader of failing to 'stop the problem they created with inflation.' Powell said he would not respond to Trump's comments.

title: Robert F. Kennedy: the difficult Senate hearing for Donald Trump's proposed health secretary
summary: The former Democrat, nominated by US president Donald Trump to be his health secretary, had a hard time justifying anti-vax statements he previously made.

title: Syria: Ahmad al-Sharaa appointed as interim president for an unspecified period
summary: The various political announcements made by the new authorities have divided Syrians.

title: Why Elon Musk is calling for a boycott of Wikipedia
summary: The owner of X regularly accuses the online encyclopedia of backing the left and being a 'propaganda' tool. His ire echoes more hatred of the media than any real political bias of the platform.

title: Takeaways from a wild day of confirmation hearings in Washington
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., Tulsi Gabbard and Kash Patel's confirmation hearings on Thursday capped a tumultuous week after the White House abruptly halted federal funding for programs Americans rely on nationwide, under guidance from Trump's budget pick Russ Vought, only to reverse course amid a public revolt.

title: Dick Button, two-time Olympic gold medalist and voice of figure skating, dies at 95
summary: 'Dick Button is the custodian of the history of figure skating and its quintessential voice,' said 1988 Olympic champ Brian Boitano. The broadcaster's death coincided with Wednesday night's tragedy of a passenger flight colliding with an Army helicopter in DC, killing everyone on board, including 14 people from the skating community.

title: Victor Wembanyama is an All-Star for the first time
summary: The French native is only the fourth San Antonio Spurs basketball player to make the All-Star Game in his first or second season. The 24 All-Stars will be drafted into three teams of eight players by TNT personalities and former NBA greats Shaquille O'Neal, Charles Barkley and Kenny Smith, introducing a new three-game format this year.

title: 'Trump rejects multilateralism and wants to win the Nobel in the Middle East by himself'
summary: The American president has promised to bring world peace to the world and has set his sights on the Nobel Prize, but by backing the Israeli ultra-right's annexationist agenda, he undermines that goal, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: 'Behind DeepSeek and the Paris summit lies the challenge of open and economical artificial intelligence'
summary: Columnist Alexandre Piquard observes that DeepSeek, the Chinese company that has caused a thunderclap in the world of artificial intelligence, offers open models with free access. But this approach, also championed by France, needs to overcome a number of challenges if it is to become a real alternative.

title: In Paris, a ceremony in honor of Alexander Solzhenitsyn, and freedom in Russia
summary: A plaque in honor of the illustrious author of 'The Gulag Archipelago,' an immense fresco of the Soviet concentration camp written underground and published in France in 1973, has been unveiled in front of the headquarters of the Franco-Russian bookshop Les Editeurs Réunis, in Paris.

title: Peru wins a round in its battle with Chile for pisco's heritage
summary: At the end of 2024, UNESCO acknowledged the authenticity of manuscripts dating back to the Spanish colonial period, which mention grape alcohol production in the Andean country as early as the 16th century. This provides an opportunity to reignite a cultural and commercial battle with Chile, which also lays claim to the designation.

title: Billie Eilish and Green Day kick off FireAid, a benefit for LA wildfire relief, with U2 making the first $1 million donation
summary: Los Angeles Clippers owner Steve Ballmer and his wife Connie will match all donations made during Thursday night's live broadcast, doubling the proceeds. Actor Billy Crystal noted that because of their pledge, U2's million-dollar donation was worth twice that amount.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote Bob Dylan
summary: Directed by James Mangold, 'A Complete Unknown' goes back over the life of Bob Dylan, a herald of '60s counterculture. The American singer, poet and musician had already released several albums when Le Monde first mentioned him, on November 26, 1965.

title: Syria's mass graves reveal Assad regime's industrial-scale repression
summary: Le Monde collected, verified and geolocated dozens of images of mass graves unearthed since the fall of Bashar al-Assad's regime. They reveal the scale of the Syrian regime's killing machine.

title: Latest Israeli hostage and Palestinian prisoner release highlights truce fragility
summary: Talks on a 'permanent' ceasefire between Israel and Hamas are set to resume on Friday, 16 days after the temporary halt in fighting, with an implementation planned for late February.

title: The risk to women's health in Afghanistan: 'The consequences of this segregation are catastrophic'
summary: New resistance fighters (2/2). In Afghanistan, only female healthcare professionals are allowed to treat women. Yet with their rights − including the right to study − being taken away, there are fewer and fewer women working in healthcare, putting half the country's population at risk.

title: Olympic balloon to return to Paris every summer up to LA Games
summary: President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that one of the most popular symbols of last summer's Olympics will be back until 2028.

title: Germany's Bundestag debates banning far-right AfD party
summary: A cross-party group of 124 MPs put a motion on the agenda to bring proceedings before the Federal Constitutional Court to ban the party, whose unprecedented alliance with the CDU caused a shock.

title: How expensive is the Louvre compared to other major art museums in the world?
summary: The standard price for one ticket to the permanent collections of the Louvre is €22, although free admission is still offered to job seekers, disabled visitors, and European residents 25 years old and under.

title: French detainee escapes during museum outing
summary: The 28-year-old is still on the run after he escaped during a visit to Paris's musée de l'Homme. He had been placed in detention for violence.

title: Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard, Trump's controversial nominees for FBI and intelligence face Senate scrutiny
summary: During their respective hearings, Kash Patel and Tulsi Gabbard promised to restore trust. However, they were chosen above all for one reason: their willingness to bend the FBI and the intelligence services to Trump's will.

title: Haiti's transitional president Leslie Voltaire announces November 2025 elections
summary: During a visit to the Elysée on Wednesday, the president of Haiti's Transitional Presidential Council promised to hold elections in November and to inaugurate an elected government by February 2026. The country's last elections were held in 2016.

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen's grave vandalized
summary: An image posted by one of the daughters of the former far-right leader, who died in January, showed that the stone cross adorning the grave had been smashed into pieces.

title: French business leaders' uninhibited anger against taxes and regulations
summary: Emmanuel Macron's business-friendly policies have disappeared with the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale and government instability. Among the most outspoken CEOs is Bernard Arnault, president of LVMH.

title: In Germany, 'economic stagnation threatens the very core of collective identity'
summary: German economist Max Krahé describes the 'mid-life crisis' affecting the German economy, whose growth model depends on exports.

title: Six Nations: French rugby's 'golden generation' aims to add another trophy to its collection
summary: The French men's rugby squad will take on Wales at the Stade de France on Friday to kick off the 2025 Six Nations Championship. France has ended the tournament in second place four out of the last five times.

title: Germany: MPs reject immigration bill from right and far right
summary: After the conservative CDU-CSU bloc joined with the far-right Alternative für Deutschland party to pass a non-binding motion cracking down on immigration on Wednesday, MPs voted 338-350 to reject a bill on the issue.

title: After five days of fighting, situation in Goma is uncertain
summary: The residents of the capital of North Kivu province, which fell into the hands of the M23 rebel group, backed by the Rwandan army, have been anxiously rediscovering the state of their town under rebel control.

title: Trump White House confirms Canada, Mexico and China tariffs to enter into force on Saturday
summary: Starting on Saturday, February 1, products coming from Canada and Mexico will be affected by 25% customs duties, and those imported from China will see tariffs rise by 10%.

title: Toward a new definition of obesity, beyond body mass index
summary: Is obesity a disease? How could it be better defined? A commission of 56 global experts from 'The Lancet' magazine has set out to define obesity, notably by distinguishing between preclinical and clinical cases.
